metadata.feature_description: Configure pagination size for content lists across social modules with options from 5 to 100 items per page.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown shows all available page size options

steps.expected: Community Settings panel opens with Page Size dropdown visible
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened successfully showing Miscellaneous Community Settings section with Page Size dropdown

steps.action: Clicked on Page Size dropdown to expand options
steps.expected: Dropdown should show all 6 options: 5, 10, 15, 25, 50, 100 items
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing all 6 options: 5 items, 10 items, 15 items, 25 items, 50 items, 100 items. Current selection was 50 items.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set page size to different value and save

steps.action: Changed Page Size from 50 items to 25 items
steps.expected: Dropdown value should change to 25 items
Settings should save with success notification
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Item successfully saved.' notification displayed

steps.action: Navigated away from Community Settings (clicked Dashboard)
Navigated back to Settings > Community Settings
steps.expected: Page Size should still show 25 items (the saved value)
steps.actual: Page Size shows 50 items instead of the saved value of 25 items. The setting did not persist despite showing a success message during save.

issues: Page Size setting does not persist after save. Value reverts to 50 items after navigating away and returning, even though the save operation showed a success message.

observations: The save operation displays a success message 'Item successfully saved.' but the Page Size value does not actually persist to the database.
Both Page Size and Comments Page Size dropdowns display all expected options (5, 10, 15, 25, 50, 100 items).
The default value for Page Size appears to be 50 items (though code shows default should be 5).
This appears to be a backend persistence issue - the API may not be correctly saving the PageSize field to the database.
